001package gust.backend.driver.firestore;
002
003import com.google.api.gax.core.CredentialsProvider;
004import com.google.api.gax.rpc.TransportChannelProvider;
005import com.google.cloud.firestore.DocumentSnapshot;
006import com.google.cloud.grpc.GrpcTransportOptions;
007import com.google.cloud.firestore.Firestore;
008import com.google.cloud.firestore.FirestoreOptions;
009import com.google.common.base.Function;
010import com.google.common.util.concurrent.Futures;
011import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
012import com.google.protobuf.Message;
013import gust.backend.model.*;
014import gust.backend.runtime.Logging;
015import gust.backend.runtime.ReactiveFuture;
016import gust.backend.transport.GoogleAPIChannel;
017import gust.backend.transport.GoogleService;
018import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Context;
019import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Factory;
020import io.micronaut.runtime.context.scope.Refreshable;
021import org.slf4j.Logger;
022
023import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
024import javax.annotation.Nullable;
025import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
026import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Objects;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
031
032
033/**
034 * Defines a built-in framework {@link DatabaseDriver} for interacting seamlessly with Google Cloud Firestore. This
035 * enables Firestore-based persistence for any {@link Message}-derived (schema-driven) business model in a given Gust
036 * app's ecosystem.
037 *
038 * <p>Model storage can be deeply customized on a per-model basis, thanks to the built-in proto annotations available
039 * in <code>gust.core</code>. The Firestore adapter supports basic persistence (i.e. as a regular
040 * <pre>PersistenceDriver</pre>), but also supports generic, object index-style queries.</p>
041 *
042 * <p><b>Caching</b> may be facilitated by any compliant cache driver, via the main Firestore adapter.</p>
043 *
044 * @see FirestoreAdapter main adapter interface for Firestore.
045 * @see FirestoreManager logic and connection manager for Firestore.
046 * @see FirestoreTransportConfig configuration class for Firestore access.
047 */
048@Immutable
049@ThreadSafe
050@SuppressWarnings("UnstableApiUsage")
051public final class FirestoreDriver<Key extends Message, Model extends Message>
052  implements DatabaseDriver<Key, Model, CollapsedMessage> {
053  /** Private log pipe. */
054  private static final Logger logging = Logging.logger(FirestoreDriver.class);
055
056  /** Executor service to use for async calls. */
057  private final ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService;
058
059  /** Codec to use for serializing/de-serializing models. */
060  private final ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec;
061
062  /** Firestore client engine. */
063  private final Firestore engine;
064
065  /** Factory responsible for creating {@link FirestoreDriver} instances from injected dependencies. */
066  @Factory
067  final static class FirestoreDriverFactory {
068    /**
069     * Acquire a new instance of the Firestore driver, using the specified configuration settings, and the specified
070     * injected channel.
071     *
072     * @param firestoreChannel Managed gRPC channel provider.
073     * @param credentialsProvider Transport credentials provider. Generally calls into ADC.
074     * @param transportOptions Options to apply to the Firestore channel.
075     * @param executorService Executor service to use when executing calls.
076     * @return Firestore driver instance.
077     */
078    @Context
079    @Refreshable
080    public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> FirestoreDriver<K, M> acquireDriver(
081      @Nonnull @GoogleAPIChannel(service = GoogleService.FIRESTORE) TransportChannelProvider firestoreChannel,
082      @Nonnull CredentialsProvider credentialsProvider,
083      @Nonnull GrpcTransportOptions transportOptions,
084      @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService,
085      @Nonnull Message.Builder builder) {
086      return new FirestoreDriver<>(
087        firestoreChannel,
088        credentialsProvider,
089        transportOptions,
090        executorService,
091        CollapsedMessageCodec.forModel(builder));
092    }
093  }
094
095  /**
096   * Construct a new Firestore driver from scratch.
097   *
098   * @param channelProvider Managed gRPC channel to use for Firestore RPCAPI interactions.
099   * @param credentialsProvider Transport credentials provider.
100   * @param transportOptions Options to apply to the transport layer.
101   * @param executorService Executor service to use when executing calls.
102   * @param codec Model codec to use with this driver.
103   */
104  private FirestoreDriver(TransportChannelProvider channelProvider,
105                          CredentialsProvider credentialsProvider,
106                          GrpcTransportOptions transportOptions,
107                          ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService,
108                          ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec) {
109    this.codec = codec;
110    this.executorService = executorService;
111    FirestoreOptions firestoreOptions = FirestoreOptions.newBuilder()
112      .setChannelProvider(channelProvider)
113      .setCredentialsProvider(credentialsProvider)
114      .setTransportOptions(transportOptions)
115      .build();
116
117    if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
118      logging.debug(String.format("Initializing Firestore driver with options:\n%s", firestoreOptions));
119    this.engine = firestoreOptions.getService();
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Deserialize the provided document snapshot, into an instance of the message we manage through this instance of the
124   * {@link FirestoreDriver}.
125   *
126   * @param snapshot Document snapshot to de-serialize.
127   * @return Inflated object record, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
128   */
129  private @Nonnull Model deserialize(@Nonnull DocumentSnapshot snapshot) {
130    throw new IllegalStateException("not yet implemented");
131  }
132
133  // -- Getters -- //
134  /** {@inheritDoc} */
135  @Override
136  public @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService() {
137    return this.executorService;
138  }
139
140  /** {@inheritDoc} */
141  @Nonnull
142  @Override
143  public ModelCodec<Model, CollapsedMessage> codec() {
144    return this.codec;
145  }
146
147  // -- API: Key Generation -- //
148  /** {@inheritDoc} */
149  @Override
150  public @Nonnull Key generateKey(@Nonnull Message instance) {
151    return null;
152  }
153
154  // -- API: Fetch -- //
155  /** {@inheritDoc} */
156  @Override
157  public @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Optional<Model>> retrieve(@Nonnull Key key, @Nonnull FetchOptions opts) {
158    ExecutorService exec = opts.executorService().orElseGet(this::executorService);
159    return ReactiveFuture.wrap(Futures.transform(ReactiveFuture.wrap(engine.getAll(), exec), new Function<>() {
160      @Override
161      public @Nonnull Optional<Model> apply(@Nullable List<DocumentSnapshot> documentSnapshots) {
162        if (documentSnapshots == null || documentSnapshots.isEmpty()) {
163          return Optional.empty();
164
165        } else if (documentSnapshots.size() > 1) {
166          throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpectedly encountered more than 1 result.");
167
168        } else {
169          return Optional.of(deserialize(
170            Objects.requireNonNull(
171              documentSnapshots.get(0),
172              "Unexpected null `DocumentReference`.")));
173        }
174      }
175    }, exec), exec);
176  }
177
178  // -- API: Persist -- //
179  /** {@inheritDoc} */
180  @Override
181  public @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Model> persist(@Nonnull Key documentReference,
182                                                @Nonnull Model model,
183                                                @Nonnull WriteOptions options) {
184    return null;
185  }
186}
